data:
Based on the provided information, the core functionalities of the product can be identified as:

* Educating workers on Occupational Risk Prevention (ORP)
* Providing access to on-site ORP training
* Monitoring ORP training

The features that fall outside these core functionalities can be identified step by step as follows:

• **Chat for resolving doubts**: This feature is not directly related to the core functionalities of the product, as it is not a part of the education process. It can be considered as a support feature.
• **Link to certification pages**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is not directly related to the education process. It can be considered as a support feature.
• **Generate content from updated sources**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is not directly related to the education process. It can be considered as a support feature.
• **Evaluate learning outcomes**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the monitoring of ORP training.
• **Report generation**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the monitoring of ORP training.
• **Contents annotation**: This feature is not a core functionality, as it is not directly related to the education process. It can be considered as a support feature.
• **Complement content with verified sources**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the education process.
• **Organize information by topics/chapters**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the education process.
• **Include corporate content**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the education process.
• **Assign training to workers**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the education process.
• **User profile management**: This feature is a core functionality, as it is related to the education process.
• **Architecture**: This is not a feature, but rather the technical infrastructure that supports the product.
• **AWS**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **PDF Editor**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Jira**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Email**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Github**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Cloud Computing**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **pgVector**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **CI/CD**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Autoscaling Groups**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Code Builder**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Web Platform**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Secrets Management**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Python**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **REST API**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **UI/UX**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **React**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Figma**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Scalability**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **GPT**: This is a part of the architecture, not a feature.
• **Risks**: These are not features, but rather potential issues that need to be addressed.
• **Negative public opinion on the use of AI**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Energy consumption**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Dependence on AI model providers**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Unfriendly interfaces**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Lack of feedback**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Poor prioritization of functionalities**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Low visibility on social media**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Difficulty in measuring training quality**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **AI use regulations**: This is a risk, not a feature.
• **Business (Goals, Markets, Users, Targets)**: These are not features, but rather information about the business and target audience.

The list of features that fall outside the core functionalities is:

• **Chat for resolving doubts**
• **Link to certification pages**
• **Generate content from updated sources**
• **Contents annotation**
• **AWS**
• **PDF Editor**
• **Jira**
